job_description:
• Currently enrolled in a US based University in a graduate program majoring in Mechanical EngineeringIf you have knowledge / experience with any of the following technical skills (or related areas) and are enthusiastic about this role, we strongly encourage you to apply –A strong background in heat transfer and fluid dynamics.
• Lab experience and hands-on experience.
• In certain projects we may have your involvement in crafting technical/functional documents and reports as needed.
• Location: Austin, TX, San Jose, CA or Santa Clara, CAOnsite/Hybrid: This role requires the student to work full time (40 hours a week), in either a hybrid or onsite work structure throughout the duration of the co-op/intern termDuration:Spring/Summer Co-op: January 26, 2026 – August 7, 2026Summer/Fall Co-op: May 18, 2026 or June 22, 2026 – December 11, 2026Spring: January 26, 2026 – May 1, 2026Summer: May 18, 2026 - August 7, 2026 or June 22, 2026 – September 11, 2026Fall: September 14, 2026 – December 11, 2026 AMD Partner Hub Authorized Distributors AMD University Program Investor Relations Financial Information Board of Directors Governance Documents SEC Filings Austin, Texas.
• Someone that’s passionate about thermal engineering Knowledge of key thermal components and new technologies in a computer including fans, heatsinks, shielding, spreaders, thermal interface materials.
• Effective with communication and building respect while communicating status to executive level audience.
• We will assign you to competitive analysis specifically focusing on cooling, performance, and acoustics.
• We will train you to be familiar with PC architecture including hands-on system setup & testingAssist lead thermal engineers on pre and post silicon deliverablesThermal design, modeling, testing, and debug of mobile and desktop products.
